metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Learn how to create popups with CSS and JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to create popups with CSS and JavaScript.

content.code: Click me!   Popup text...
content.code_html:
<div class="popup" onclick="myFunction()">Click me!
  <span class="popuptext" id="myPopup">Popup text...</span>
</div>

syntaxHighlighting.text: position: relative;  display: inline-block;  cursor: pointer;

syntax_highlighting.text: position: relative;  display: inline-block;  cursor: pointer;

content.code_html:
/* Popup container */
.popup {
  position: relative;
  display: inline-block;
  cursor: pointer;
}

/* The actual popup (appears on top) */
.popup .popuptext {
  visibility: hidden;
  width: 160px;
  background-color: #555;
  color: #fff;
  text-align: center;
  border-radius: 6px;
  padding: 8px 0;
  position: absolute;
  z-index: 1;
  bottom: 125%;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -80px;
}

/* Popup arrow */
.popup .popuptext::after {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 100%;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -5px;
  border-width: 5px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: #555 transparent transparent transparent;
}

/* Toggle this class when clicking on the popup container (hide and show the popup) */
.popup .show {
  visibility: visible;
  -webkit-animation: fadeIn 1s;
  animation: fadeIn 1s
}

/* Add animation (fade in the popup) */
@-webkit-keyframes fadeIn {
  from {opacity: 0;}
  to {opacity: 1;}
}

@keyframes fadeIn {
  from {opacity: 0;}
  to {opacity:1 ;}
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: position: relative;  display: inline-block;  cursor: pointer;

syntaxHighlighting.text:
// When the user clicks on <div>, open the popupfunction 
myFunction() {  var popup = document.getElementById("myPopup");  popup.classList.toggle("show");}
// When the user clicks on <div>, open the popup

content.code:
<script>// When the user clicks on <div>, open the popupfunction 
myFunction() {  var popup = document.getElementById("myPopup");  popup.classList.toggle("show");}</script>

// When the user clicks on <div>, open the popup

content.code_html:
<script>
// When the user clicks on <div>, open the popup
function myFunction() {
  var popup = document.getElementById("myPopup");
  popup.classList.toggle("show");
}
</script>

content.text: Tip: Tooltips are similar to popups. Go to our How To Create Tooltips Tutorial to learn about tooltips.
